author: glasser
msg: Backport r23815:
Fix bug in authz code related to inconclusive responses to global
access checks.
Justification:
Simple and obvious fix, low risk, problems in authz code should be
fixed asap.
Notes:
Bug was found in production on svn.apache.org, currently requires
a local patch whenever we upgrade that machine's svn install.
Votes:
+1: rooneg, hwright, glasser

author: glasser
msg: * STATUS
Vote against backporting all of mucc's changes up through
March; we should either backport even more (including
the s/mucc/svnmucc/g) or none at all.

author: glasser
msg: * subversion/tests/cmdline/davautocheck.sh
Allow you to run davautocheck against *installed* modules,
by setting the MODULE_PATH environment variable.

author: glasser
msg: Followup to r27477: make sure the merge_authz test actually passes!
* subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_authz_tests.py
(): Import setup_branch and shorten_path_kludge from merge_tests.py.
(shorten_path_kludge): Remove, as it is now imported.

author: glasser
msg: Fix running tests in parallel mode under DAV.  Specifically, document
that you can't write authz files in parallelized tests, and move the
one merge test that does out of the merge_tests.py file.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_tests.py
(mergeinfo_and_skipped_paths): Move this test (and some imports that
are only used by it) from here...
* subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_authz_tests.py
... to this new test file, which has serial_only = True.
* build.conf
(test-scripts): Register new test file.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/svntest/main.py
(write_authz_file): Add a big scary comment forbidding you from
using this function in parallelizable tests.
